Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2009 03:48PM Momof6 wrote: I go April 7th for the Fine Needle Aspiration and the Ultrasound on my right breast.  The nodule they found in my left breast I couldn't feel...and wasn't showing up in the last two mammograms I had.  I need to stop worrying...huh?  :o)  I am a worrier anyway.  People tell me to stop worrying about things I can't control...but it is hard especially when it is your body!  Good luck to you...please keep me informed about your meeting on Monday...I wish you well!  msmanna at getinvolvedinyourtown dot com if you want to email me.
Posts.Title: Nodules & Calcifications Momof6 1osugrl

Posts.Content: Momof6 wrote: Hi, I am new here and just need to talk to someone who has been in the position I have found myself in.  I am 42 years old and just had a Mammogram February 25.  This is my 5th Mammogram.  I asked the technician the day of my Mammogram if they saw anything that stuck out they would let me know right away and she told me yes, so when the Mammogram was done and they let me go I thought things were good.  A couple weeks went by and I thought no news is good news ...so everything must be fine. Wrong....I received a phone call at work from my doctors office, as soon as I heard the nurse on the phone I said "Whats wrong"...she told me the test results were in from my Mammogram the results:  7mm oval nodule density with circumscribed margin in the left breast in the middle depth of the laterial region seen on the craniocaudal view only that most likely represents a cyst.  No significant masses, calcifications, or other findings are seen in the right breast.  Ok...so I was told I have to go for a follow up Mammogram and an Ultrasound also.  I went for the follow up Mammogram and the Ultrasound.  The left breast is of concern and more pictures are taken, I saw the Nodule they were concerned about it was long.  The technician told me the Doctor wanted a compression again of my right breast too....I asked why and was told she thought she saw something of concern.  (No mention in the previous Mammogram.)  So I had the right one done again also.  Afterwards I was off to Ultra Sound.   Only my right breast was being looked at for this...the technician scanned my breast and took the images, after about 10 minutes of taking the pictures she stopped and called the doctor...she said she had enough, she also told me I had a lot of cysts.  The doctor came in and started taking images and she showed me the area of concern...a solid nodule...I asked how the edges looked and she said "iffy"...I will be going for a fine needle apsiration / biopsy in a couple of weeks.  Well, after I left and got home I got a call from the doctor, she said that we never went over the findings in the right breast.  She told me that she saw what looked like calcifications in my right breast and something that looked like a "starburst"...I explained to her about a year and a half ago I had an Ultrasound for lumps under my right arm and they were lymphnodes, but they weren't concerned about them.  I also told her I had a breast biopsy about 15 years ago for a lump that got bigger and I had a scar.  None the less I will be getting an Ultrasound on the right side to look at the nodes ...I never asked her though if the calcifications she is seeing could be scar tissue.  Needless to say I am worried.  Sorry for the long post...the waiting is terrible and I have no one to talk to about it...I could talk to family but I don't want to get them worried if this turns out to be nothing.  My husband tells me not to worry and I will be ok.  I want to believe that but there is that part of me that says "What if it is cancer?"  My Mom had Uterine & Breast Cancer.  She surrvived those two..she did passaway though from lung cancer three years ago. Okay...thanks to whomever reads this. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Nodules & Calcifications Momof6 1osugrl

Posts.Content: Mar 21, 2009 03:07PM Momof6 wrote: Dealite - I wish you well...the waiting is hard and no one to talk to is also.  I copied this from Healthscout.com Breast calcifications are deposits of calcium that can be seen on a mammogram of the breast. There are two types: macrocalcifications and microcalcifications Most breast calcifications are benign. The term microcalcification is often used for calcifications found with malignancy, which are usually smaller, more numerous, clustered, and variously shaped (rods, branches, teardrops). Calcifications associated with benign conditions are usually larger, fewer in number, widely dispersed, and round. In the middle are hard-to-tell calcifications which are often labeled indeterminate.

Posts.Content: Mar 23, 2009 03:54PM Momof6 wrote: I went today to get my Ultrasound & Mammogram images along with the Ultrasound & followup Mammogram reports.  The reports for the Ultrasound & Mammogram match:  There is a focal asymmetry in the right upper outer breast associated with loosley grouped miocrocalcifications.  This asymmetry thins partially on additional compression views.  There is a nodule in the left outer likely upper breast that measures 8mm, Targeted Ultrasound of the left breast was performed on the same day and showed multiple cysts including a cluster of cyst at 2:00 o'clock 2 cm from the nipple measuring 7x3x4mm with no internal vascularity.  A flat elongated cyst is also noted at the same position 3cm from the nipple and measures 6x8x2mm. There is ildefined hypoechoic probably solid nodule at 3 o'clock 1cm from the nipple measuring 5x4x3mm with no internal vascularity.  This may correspond to the mammographic finding of the left breast nodule. BI-RADS:  4b Suspicious of abnormality - intermediate suspicion of malignancy Any thoughts from anyone?  Has anyone gotten similar results?  I am driving myself nuts looking at my views and those on the web!
Posts.Title: Nodules & Calcifications Momof6 1osugrl

Posts.Content: Mar 29, 2009 11:31PM Momof6 wrote: The waiting is hard.  My Mammo & US is Birads 4b - and I am paraying it is not cancer.  I called the radiology department to see if there was a waiting list to get on so I could get my biopsy done sooner.  Doesn't hurt to ask.  I go on April 7th.  I have what appears to be a solid nodule in my left breast and "loosley grouped microcalcification" in my right, with a Focal Asymmetry (which I think is what she told me was the "starburst" shape).  It is nerve wracking try to stay positive.  Yesterday I spent the day with my husband shopping and the evening I spent rearranging bedrooms...wow, did that keep my mind off the lumps and bumps!  Keep us informed!
Posts.Title: MoM of toddlers with breast pain waiting for relults help nboerner SandyL

Posts.Content: Mar 27, 2009 12:06PM Momof6 wrote: Hi - I knew I was going back for a biopsy (I go on April 7th Birads 4b LB / Calcification and "starburst image" in RB) and listened to what the radiologist had to say, called my doctor and spoke to him about it....but never saw the actual report.  I called the radiology department and asked for a copy of all my reports (mammogram, diagnostic mammo & ultrasound) I also asked for all the pictures.  Part of me wishes I didn't do that...but the other part of me is glad.  Now I have my reports and photos...all on a disc too.  (That amazed me)  My Doctors nurse told me to get all my reports that way if I wanted a second opinion too I would have everything and not have to wait.  I hope everything goes well for you!
Posts.Title: Can I ask for immediate results? golfncaroline Momof6

Posts.Content: Apr 5, 2009 03:08AM Momof6 wrote: chernesky - I agree with Idaho.  That nurse had NO business tellin you the results were not favorable...she is not a Doctor.  I would demand she at least get spoken to with a follow up to you.  I had a Dr. once who had nurses like that I complained to the doc and eventually fired the doctor and got a new one. They can not just fax you the results I don't think. You need to sign a release.  If you want your records call where you got your tests done and tell them you want all your medical records  (reports & images) from the dates you were tested.  As for the Xanax...it is addicting...so I think your Doctor was looking out for you... I wish you the best and keep us informed!
